### Read problem statements in [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/bengali/SHUFFLIN.pdf), [Mandarin Chinese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/mandarin/SHUFFLIN.pdf), [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/russian/SHUFFLIN.pdf), and [Vietnamese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/vietnamese/SHUFFLIN.pdf) as well. Chef is given an array $A$ consisting of $N$ positive integers. Chef shuffles the array $A$ and creates a new array $B$ of length $N$, where $B_i = (A_i + i) \bmod 2$, for each $i\;(1 \leq i \leq N)$. Find the maximum possible sum of integers of the array $B$, if Chef shuffles the array $A$ optimally.
All submissions for this problem are available.

problemComponents.constraints:
- $1 \leq T \leq 10^4$
- $1 \leq N \leq 10^5$
- $1 \leq A_i \leq 10^9$
- Sum of $N$ over all test cases does not exceed $3 \cdot 10^5$.
problemComponents.statement:
### Read problem statements in [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/bengali/SHUFFLIN.pdf), [Mandarin Chinese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/mandarin/SHUFFLIN.pdf), [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/russian/SHUFFLIN.pdf), and [Vietnamese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/SEPT21/vietnamese/SHUFFLIN.pdf) as well.

Chef is given an array $A$ consisting of $N$ positive integers. Chef shuffles the array $A$ and creates a new array $B$ of length $N$, where $B_i = (A_i + i) \bmod 2$, for each $i\;(1 \leq i \leq N)$.

Find the maximum possible sum of integers of the array $B$, if Chef shuffles the array $A$ optimally.
problemComponents.inputFormat:
- The first line of the input contains a single integer $T$ denoting the number of test cases. The description of $T$ test cases follows.
- Each test case contains two lines of input.
- The first line of each test case contains an integer $N$.
- The second line of each test case contains $N$ space-separated integers $A_1, A_2, \dots, A_N$.
problemComponents.outputFormat: For each test case, print a single line containing one integer - the maximum sum of integers of the array $B$.

sampleTestCases.explanation:
**Test case $1$:** One of the optimal ways to shuffle the array $A$ is $[2, 1, 3]$. Then the array $B = [(2 + 1) \bmod 2,\;(1 + 2) \bmod 2,\;(3 + 3) \bmod 2] = [1, 1, 0]$. So the sum of integers of array $B$ is $2$. There is no other possible way to shuffle array $A$ such that the sum of integers of array $B$ becomes greater than $2$.


**Test case $2$:** One of the optimal ways to shuffle the array $A$ is $[2, 5, 4]$. Then the array $B = [(2 + 1) \bmod 2,\;(5 + 2) \bmod 2,\;(4 + 3) \bmod 2] = [1, 1, 1]$. So the sum of integers of array $B$ is $3$ .
